name: Villa Oriana Relais

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent six nights her at the end of August. The hotel is situated high above the bay of Naples in a quiet location with perfect views of Versuvius and beyond. It has only seven rooms and is very homely. When we arrived we were treated to home made lemonade and made to feel welcome. The room was spotlessly clean, as was everywhere else, the shower was excellent, the a/c worked very well and silently and the bed was very comfortable. Breakfasts always consisted of local produce and home baked cakes and savouries cooked that morning. Maria, Dorotea and Pasquale made us feel like part of a family and would always help with any request. Finally, make sure you buy a bottle of Maria's lemoncello to take home it is superb
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

likes.disliked: — Walk up the hill to reach it if not hiring a car

Over Priced and Over Rated
reviews.text: I don’t think I have ever been so annoyed or disappointed with accommodation in all our years of travelling. We were looking forward to our first trip to Sorrento, and on arrival got a taxi to the Villa as we weren’t quite sure how to get there. The Villa is at least a 15 minute walk from the town centre and up an incredibly steep hill; however we weren’t perturbed by this as we had read such good reviews about the Villa. After booking our 5 night stay 5 months in advance, on our arrival Pasquale announced that a “mistake” had been made, they had over booked and we would have to stay in a 4 star hotel up the road (Grand Paradiso Hotel). We were assured that this hotel was “very beautiful” and that Pasquale would pay the difference to the hotel as it was “more expensive”. I read past reviews of the Grand Paradiso Hotel as I wasn’t impressed at all with the Hotel, a lot of reviews weren’t favourable and understandably so. I duly enquired when I got to the hotel the price of this accommodation, there was indeed a difference of 50 Euro, I was quoted a price which was 50 Euro CHEAPER than the room we had booked at the Villa Oriana! We decided against kicking up a fuss over the price as we had 4 nights to spend at the Villa and thought it would be in our best interests to be as amiable as possible in light of this fiasco, however after arriving back to the villa, the family & staff made us feel very unwelcome and in general were quite rude to us. Pasquale also promised us “the best room in the house” by way of compensation when he dropped us up to the hotel, to our detriment our room was literally right beside the front door and all we could hear was people coming in during the early hours of the morning and talking from 7 am onwards, we could not sleep as we kept being woken by the goings on and the traffic in the hallway outside our door, I would safely say this was one of the worst rooms in the house. We went to Sorrento for a break but left feeling exhausted, ripped off and baffled by the good reviews the Villa has received. Maria, the owner was indeed quite nice and made an effort to speak to us at breakfast like she did all guests but that aside I could not recommend this accommodation, it’s exceptionally over priced and in no way convenient to the town of Sorrento….in a word…avoid!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Villa Oriana is a wonderful B&B, owned and staffed by tremendously nice people. Within minutes of booking the reservation, we received a warm welcome and were treated to the same hospitality throughout our stay. Dorotea was extremely helpful in recommending local restaurants and setting up trips around the region. The rooms were very comfortable, clean, and spacious. The setting was lovely. Much of Villa Oriana's charm comes from Maria, the owner. She cooks delicious breakfast treats using ingredients from her own garden and lemon grove. And Maria is so warm and welcoming that you can't help but enjoy your stay. I would go back again and have already recommended it to others.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at Villa Oriana

reviews.text: Villa Oriana is located little above Sorrento like a magnificent pearl in the middle of green trees of lemon and orange. I stayed there with my wife during 4th Mediterranean Congress of Urgent and we were more than pleased with our hosts Maria and Giuseppe. Villa Oriana has the best view to the Gulf of Naples, clean and nicely decorated rooms where you’ll have great sleep, especially if you’re coming from a big, noisy city. The best thing in this small hotel is Jacuzzi at the very top of hotel from which you’ll have great view to the Vesuvius. In that tub I felt like a Plinius junior.
reviews.title: The Pearl of Sorrento

reviews.text: We had booked directly with the owners a few months before travelling to Sorrento. We were full of high hopes as the website pictures looked fantastic, but our hopes were soon dashed on arrival. After a lengthy period of being left out on the deck we were finally shown to our "room". This involved walking back up the path and out the gates to a house across the road! This house was definitely of a lower standard than the Villa. We were shattered. I suspect they had overbooked and this house nearby was to take the 'overflow'. Be warned!
reviews.title: Disappointed
incredible
reviews.text: Sadly they were not prepared to drop the price, and as it was around 5-6pm we were not easily able to find alternative accommodation (it was late August) so were forced to take it. The price is very high here anyway, and cash payment preferred. We knew that and would have been happy to pay that price if we had got what was advertised. Unfortunately we got a very second rate deal.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another gripe was the jacuzzi. It was on the roof and available for guests but not after 6 pm at night. Night time would have been the ideal time to use it and admire the views over Sorrento after a tiring day sight-seeing. The logic of that rule escaped me.
reviews.title: Our Home Away From Home

description: An elegant and essential accommodation, refined and with all the comfort and welcoming of an exclusive retreat. Villa Oriana Relais is located in Sorrento, only 5 minutes by car from Tasso Square, the main square of the town and has a breathtaking view of the bay of Naples.The d’Esposito family, has managed this wonderful Relais with passion for years, welcomes the guests like friends.
